item.description:
**Sunday is the first day of standard time. Set your clocks back one hour before you go to bed Saturday night**

Let's climb the newest addition to the 52 with a view list, Mt Roberts, which was promoted earlier this year in favor of Mt Wolf. Roberts is 2582' high and the hike has a vertical climb of approx 1900' over 8 miles (4 miles out and back via the Shannon Brook and Roberts Trails).

**Given the time of year, traction is required** Microspikes are best. I have some spare equipment but you must clear this with me before the hike. Otherwise I expect all participants to have this essential gear.

Hike to start at 8 am - carpooling hopefully an option to discuss with those that sign up, Let me know if you have any questions. Andrew B

Below is a gear list is based on Michael Blair's excellent list (thanks) - and is to be considered the MINIMUM amount of things to bring on this trip. Don't expect someone else will have extras of anything: you need to carry all the stuff you will need.

Footwear: Hiking boots or trail shoes. Light traction is mandatory (microspikes strongly recommended, yaktracks or stabilicers will probably suffice).

Clothing: Dress in layers to easily regulate body temperature. Wear synthetic shirt/pants and bring a fleece jacket/wool sweater - ABSOLUTELY NO COTTON.

Outerwear: Waterproof/windproof rain jacket with hood, rain pants, hat, gloves.

Food and Water: High-energy snacks, food for lunch, and at least three quarts of water (electrolyte drink recommended - cut it in half or third with water as they have too much sugar for all-day activity).

Other Essential Gear: Map and compass. Plastic whistle. Headlamp with two sets of spare batteries. An emergency space blanket (e.g. mylar). Small pocket knife or multi-purpose tool. Toilet kit (e.g. hand sanitizer, toilet paper and a zip-lock bag to pack out your used personal hygiene items). Sunscreen. Lip balm. Sunglasses. Insect repellent. Waterproof cover for your pack.

Optional Items: Waterproof gaiters. Trekking poles. Camera.

You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip.

While I will bring a group first aid kit that contains basic items I am not certified or trained in wilderness first aid. You will need to bring any medications or medical supplies that you may need during the trip.
item.name: Mt Roberts (52 with a view) Intermediate Hike
